intro: Rossittia scabra, commonly known as the rough scabra, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is adapted to cool, moist climates. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
